name: The US Grant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The U.S. Grant is a beatiful hotel in a somewhat run down part of downtown San Diego. Our room was nicely decorated, but smelled musty..The halls smelled even worse. The housekeeping was very "sub-par", as one past reviewer noted. They left dirty glasses, didn't dust or wipe down surfaces, and didn't refill toiletries or coffee. The staff was friendly, especially the doormen..and we always got a greeting and smiles upon arrivals.
reviews.title: Disappointed with housekeeping

likes.disliked: — Lack of attention to daily room cleaning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel and I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone. It is a very grand hotel and everything is very tasteful. We had booked the romance package and included in the price was champagne in the room, a flower arrangement with red roses and breakfast each morning. Our bedroom was lovely with a kingsize bed and top quality linens. The bathroom was spacious and again had excellent amenities. The situation of this hotel is excellent . It is across the road from the Horton Plaza shopping centre and also the Gaslamp Quarter, which is very lively in the evenings. It is also within walking distance of Petco Park and we attended our first ball game whilst there. The trolley bus for the sightseeing tour is just across the road from the hotel. The food in the hotel was excellent and all staff gave excellent service. Nothing was too much trouble for them. If I stayed in San Diego again I would not even consider staying anywhere else.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved the US Grant!

likes.liked: — Everything! The hotel, staff, situation were all excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just spent 3 nights at the U.S.Grant in San Diego,and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The hotel is beautiful,the rooms are spacious and well appointed. the staff most helpful and polite, and to top it all off it is perfectly located in the centre of everything
reviews.title: loved the Grant

likes.disliked: — no bathtub pay for internet in the room \

reviews.text: I got this hotel on a deal on Sky Auction.com. My husband and I spent 4 days there and enjoyed every minute of it. The service of this hotel is wonderful. All the staff is very friendly and helpful, some of the best service I have ever had in a hotel and I have stayed some nice places. The Grant Grill is pricey but it was the best food I had all my vacation, the chicken hash is not to be missed. If you like beer, the yard house is right next store and it has the largest draft beer selection in the world. Overall this hotel met all expectations. I would stay there again in a heart beat.
reviews.title: Great service, awesome location

reviews.text: Design-wise, the hotel lobby and restaurant/lounge are nice and decent, but not breathtaking or cutting edge. That's why it's surprising when you walk into your hotel room. It's quite gorgeous, as well as the bathroom. Very nicely decorated, the painted headboard is a nice touch. Some might find the room size a tad bit small, but we had no complaints.
reviews.title: Location Is A Blessing & Curse.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is perfectly situated in downtown San Diego. Pretty much everything (Gaslamp, Petco Park, Convention Center, etc) is within walking distance. However this becomes a problem in the morning when the downtown rush hour traffic wakes you up. The hotel's not very high, so it's very difficult to escape the noise.
reviews.title: Happy Memories of US Grant

likes.liked: — Room was large, clean and nicely decorated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed there for 2 nights last weekend. I initially chose it for it's history and recent remodel. The hotel is smack dab in middle of gaslamp district with plenty of shops, restaurants, clubs within walking distance. Trolley and bus stops are steps away from hotel doors. Hotel itself is gorgeous! **Ask concierge to view the hotel's archive photgraph book.**
reviews.title: Impressive & Great Location...will return!!

reviews.text: I booked the romatic getaway package for about $300 per night. This was supposed to include king bed room with view, floral arrangement, champagne, and breakfast up to $50. The room itself was fabulous and I was pleasantly surprised as it looked much like the pictures from hotel website. It was also clean and well decorated. It was extremely quiet and I never once heard anyone next door - as is usually the case in hotel rooms.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, fabulous service!
Nice hotel in great location
reviews.text: Just spent two nights at US Grant; the hotel is right in the center of downtown San Diego which allows you to walk to almost anywhere and enjoy the Gaslamp Quarter.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a nice lobby, but I agree with previous reviews, its nothing special, which is a shame. I would make it a more attractive place where people can meet, as this hotel is clearly a Grande Dame.
reviews.title: Impeccable Service

reviews.text: The rooms are great; I am a Platinium member and got upgraded to a deluxe room (1106), on the last floor with view of the city. The bed are large and comfortable and the bathroom is great, with a jacuzzi built in.
reviews.title: OK but room for improvement

reviews.text: All in all I would recommend this hotel for its charm, location and good concierge service ( especially the Dutch woman)
reviews.title: Uylesses S Grant would have loved this place too

likes.disliked: — Could have used a better way of dusting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The US Grant has it figured out. Service is impeccable and they seem to make it look effortless. The property itself is very nice. Gorgeous lobby and comfortable rooms. Do understand, this is a downtown hotel so the rooms are not massive. They do not have a pool (I think you can use the Horton Plaza Hotel pool though, I am not sure), the gym is in a basement (although the equipment is quite good) and I believe the spa services are done off site.
reviews.title: Overall, 9 out of 10

description: Our Luxury San Diego Hotel offers an exquisite experience in one of America's finest cities. The US Grant has a luxury experience with a historic feel to make your trip to San Diego memorable.
